episodes.title: Marc & Mitch make a Scientology Film  #1 - How It Started & How We Did It
episodes.description:
Roll up the curtains as we journey behind the scenes of Scientology's unique film production with industry insiders Marc Headley and Mitch Brisker. Marc brings a wealth of experience from his 15-year stint at Golden Air Productions, while Mitch, a professional director, sprinkles in his creativity and unique perspective. Together, they shed light on Scientology's global audio-visual distribution, the fluctuating crew numbers, and the fascinating details of creating the film TR-8 - Start, Change, & Stop. Buckle up, as we embark on a fascinating tour of Golden Era Productions, shaped by L. Ron Hubbard's script and the undeniably charismatic actor Geoffrey Lewis.

The second act of our journey navigates through the dramatic twists of Scientology's film production. Remember the chaos when L. Ron Hubbard ordered a halt to Scientology conventions and events, only for David Miscavige to revive them? Marc and Mitch relive those days, sharing the struggle of juggling events and film production and how Scientology Media Productions ultimately came to the rescue. They also delve into the peculiarities of their studio - think Tom Sawyer-inspired men's room, an Egyptian-style makeup room, and a princess-themed women's bathroom. It's not your typical studio, right?

As we draw the curtain on our behind-the-scenes tour, Marc and Mitch recall the food challenges on the set of TR8, Start, Change, Stop - late deliveries, lack of quality, and a dollar-a-day food allowance. They also discuss the technical and costume issues that arose during filming and share their experiences of working under the demanding and intricate orders of L. Ron Hubbard. What was it like to shoot a film under such conditions, you ask? Tune in and find out everything about the unwritten and unseen stories that shape Scientology's film production. It's a roller coaster ride you won't want to miss.

episodes.title: Scientology Spy Files #17 -  Unmasking a Scientology Internet Whistleblower
episodes.description:
What if the simplest of words led to the unmasking of a covert whistleblower? Hold on to your seats as we venture deep into the enigmatic world of Scientology, and discover how the church maneuvered through a labyrinth of online postings to uncover a truth they were desperate to hide. This gripping tale of Marc and Claire Headley's escape and the rumblings they caused within the Church of Scientology will leave you spellbound.

Witness the unraveling of an incredible puzzle as we dissect the intriguing case of BFG, an online whistle-blower who dared to expose the alleged abuses of David Miscavige, the leader of Scientology. We take you through the labyrinth of BFG's cryptic online posts, analyzing symbols, phrases, and undeniable connections that led straight to Marc Headley. From a seemingly innocuous word to the involvement of Marc's sister, Stephanie Headley, and the intertwining roles of Pat Gualtieri and other Scientology Spies, prepare for a riveting investigation unlike any other.

As we come to the breathtaking climax, grasp how the Office of Special Affairs International mobilized its legal machinery and the strategies they considered to confront Marc Headley. Finally, we hint at what's to come in our riveting series on Scientology's Spy Files. Whether you're a critic, a follower, or merely curious about the untold tales of Scientology, this episode will have you captivated from start to finish. episodes.title: Where is Shelly Miscavige #16 with Claire Headley - Former Sea Organization Member - Karen Pressley
episodes.description:
Welcome to another riveting conversation with our guest, Karen Schless Pressley, who offers an intimate look into her experiences with the enigmatic Shelly Miscavige and the secretive world of Scientology. With firsthand knowledge about Shelly's life under the guardianship of L. Ron Hubbard and an insider's view of the Religious Technology Center, Karen dissects complex layers of this controversial organization.

This episode uncovers the in-depth details about the inner working of Scientology, from the peculiar office spaces - complete with custom-sized furniture - to the contradicting practices against fundraising. Prepare to be fascinated as we shine a light on the paranoia that grips the organization's leadership and influences its policies. The conversation also touches on the disturbing culture within Scientology, the concerns surrounding Shelly's mental state, and the ripple effects these have on its members.

Karen also explores the perplexing transformation of the organization over the years, peculiarities such as the demand for a uniform based on the movie 'The English Patient' and the questionable financial activities that comprise the functioning of the Religious Technology Center. This journey concludes with a prognosis of David Miscavige's paranoia and the restrictive policies he implemented within the Religious Technology Center, all intended to isolate members from the outside world. This episode is a trove of intriguing revelations and thought-provoking discussions, not just for those interested in Scientology, but for any curious mind intrigued by the complexities of human behavior and belief systems.

episodes.title: Where is Shelly Miscavige? #15 with Claire Headley - Former Sea Org Member and Author Karen Pressley
episodes.description:
Curious about the unexpected twists and turns in the harrowing journey of author Karen Schless Pressley? Get ready to be taken on a chilling ride as we expose the mysteries within the Church of Scientology and its controversial leader, David Miscavige. Today's episode uncovers the heartrending account of Karen, a former member of the Church, who unmasks the ruthless tactics of Miscavige and the disturbing narrative behind his wife, Shelly’s unexplained 18-year absence.

It gets more intense as Karen takes us through her time in the international management public relations office, sharing her traumatic experiences and detailing the cruelty she witnessed whilst working under Miscavige. The unsettling influence of Nazi propaganda on the Church's cold, merciless motif brings an alarming perspective. Together we delve into Shelly's role in all of this, revealing her human side amidst the harsh realities of her position as the COB Assistant.

Karen's escape towards freedom is a testament of her resilience and bravery. Despite being promoted to roles that she wasn't prepared for, she held on to her sense of self and humanity. How did she navigate the strict hierarchical system of the Church of Scientology and take the courageous steps towards truth and liberation? Learn from Karen as she shares her riveting narrative, leaving no stone unturned about life inside this infamous organization. Expect shocking revelations and a refreshing perspective in this deeply stirring episode.

episodes.title: Where is Shelly Miscavige? #14 w/ Claire Headley - Former Sea Organization Member Sterling Tompkins
episodes.description:
Could you imagine the uncertainty of not knowing where your family member is for over a decade? That's the painful reality for our guest Sterling Tompkins, who joins us in this stirring episode to discuss the puzzling case of Shelly Miscavige, the wife of the Scientology leader, David Miscavige. Shelly, once an ever-present figure, who has been conspicuously absent from public view since 2005, stirring a whirlpool of questions and theories. Sterling, Shelly's brother-in-law and nephew, lends a unique perspective to our conversation as we traverse the complex family dynamics and the enigma encircling Shelly's absence.

This isn't just a chat about a disappearance; it's a deep dive into the intricacies of our shared experiences within the Church of Scientology. We reminisce about our respective families, our upbringing within the institution, and the strains on our relationships triggered by David Miscavige's influence. We recall the memories of Shelly and David and how the aftermath of Lisa McPherson's wrongful death in 1995 marked a significant turn in their relationship.

But our chat doesn't end there. We take a moment to reflect on the present and the future - how our past experiences have molded us, and the importance of recognizing those who've managed to do good despite the Church's practices. We open the floor to our audience, inviting you to engage with us in our ongoing conversation about our experiences and the different perspectives they bring. Join us, as we continue to untangle this complex narrative and illuminate the darker corners of our shared history.

episodes.title: Where is Shelly Miscavige #13 w/ Claire Headley - Former Sea Organization Member - Bruce Hines
episodes.description:
*** We are re-uploading this video. Our original file does not have any pauses or audio missing. Will publish new video once it has processed. Thanks and sorry for the inconvenience. 


Uncover the murky mysteries of Scientology with me and my  friend, Bruce Hines, as we delve into a chilling tale of disappearance and conjecture. Can you imagine what it's like to disappear from the face of the earth? Shelly Miscavige, wife of Scientology leader David Miscavige, did just that and has been missing for 18 years. Bruce, who knew and worked with Shelly, shares his personal insights and experiences, offering a rare look into the lives of David and Shelly Miscavige within the confines of the Scientology headquarters.

Journey back with us to our time living at the International Base 8, a place infused with the aroma of garlic fields and the haunting echoes of tragic losses. We reminisce about the peculiar Christmas morning interactions with Shelly, revealing a human side rarely seen in the stern environment of Scientology. As we dive deeper, Bruce recounts the devastating death of fellow Scientologist Andy Hoden and his eerie experience of being present when she passed away. A story that intertwines tragedy, loss, and the enigmatic mechanisms of the Scientology church.

Join us as we dissect the harsh conditions of Shelly's seclusion, the alleged brainwashing techniques, and the stringent security measures at the International Base. As we peel back the layers of the mystery behind Shelly's disappearance, we also ponder on what we would say to her if given a chance today. This conversation is an intriguing exploration of a story that continues to baffle and captivate many to this day. So, brace yourself for an episode that promises to offer an insightful examination of a story that penetrates the heart of Scientology and leaves you questioning the very nature of faith and power.

episodes.title: Scientology Stories #19 with Claire Headley - Hana Whitfield Eltringham
episodes.description:
Prepare yourself for a voyage into Scientology's stormy seas as my guest, Hana Eltringham Whitfield, and I share our intense experiences from our time in the Sea Organization. Imagine being tasked with the impossible - securing a new home for 300 students and staff in Alicante, all on a Saturday night. We recount these moments of chaos, the high-stakes interactions with a local cab driver, and our triumph amidst turmoil when we finally secured a building.

Set sail with us as we revisit the turbulent journey from Valencia onboard the Avon River. It wasn't smooth sailing, to say the least. As I took over the helm, we battled unpredictable weather, avoided troll boats, and bore witness to L. Ron Hubbard's unforgettable domestic disputes - broadcasted via bullhorn for the entire ship to hear. Our expedition was fraught with danger but also tinged with the scent of adventure and freedom.

Now, brace for impact as we expose the chilling underbelly of Scientology's manipulation tactics. Listen closely as Leon and Amos, two of our fellow Sea Org members, recount their covert mission to Tunisia. Their task? To secure the release of Mrs. Vicky Livingston from airport security using nothing but an elaborate cover story and a symbolic red silk rosette. Their chilling success offers a window into the disturbing ways Scientology manipulates government officials and police forces, a practice still in effect today. Buckle up for an emotional whirlwind as we unpack these real-life adventures and chilling tales from the enigmatic world of Scientology. Let's set sail, shall we?

episodes.title: Scientology Stories #17 with Claire Headley - Former Sea Org Member & Author Katherine Spallino
episodes.description:
Are you ready to be moved, challenged, and enlightened? Brace yourselves for a deeply engaging conversation with Katherine Spallino, the author of 'The Bad Cadet', as we unpack her intimate journey of growing up in, and ultimately escaping from, the confines of the Scientology Cadet Organization. Hear directly from Katherine herself about the indoctrination she experienced from a young age, her hard-fought journey to reclaim her freedom and the resilience it took to navigate the often tumultuous waters of familial relationships within the organization.

This isn't just about the captivating narrative of one woman's escape from a high-control organization - it's also about the transformative power of language and the potent role it plays in healing. We'll explore Katherine's writing process, the invaluable support she received, and the parallels drawn between Scientology's control mechanisms and George Orwell's dystopian novel, '1984'. Is there something to be gleaned from resources like Victor Frankl's 'Man's Search for Meaning' and Tara Westover's 'Educated'? Stick with us to find out.

Finally, we'll delve into the significant role of platforms like YouTube in amplifying stories that often elude mainstream media. Hear how sharing her personal experiences became a therapeutic process for Katherine and how connections outside of Scientology can serve as lifelines for those still inside. From the depths of the challenges to the peaks of gratitude for the support and validation she received throughout her journey, Katherine's story is one you won't want to miss.

episodes.title: Scientology Stories #18 with Claire Headley - Former Scientologist Cindy Plahuta
episodes.description:
Join me as I embark on an incredible journey with my dear friend Cindy Plahuta, taking a deep dive into her strange and fascinating experience with Scientology. Her tale unfolds from a unique encounter with the organization in the early 90s, our shared memories at the Celebrity Center, and the shocking conversations that followed my initiation into the Sea Organization. The path is fraught with revelations as Cindy peels back the layers of her time within the organization, the eerie call to the ethics office, her ascent through the OT Levels, and the heartbreaking declaration of her friend's brother-in-law as a suppressive person.

Our heartfelt conversation takes a tender turn as we ponder upon the concept of chosen family and the excruciating pain of disconnection that Scientology imposes. We cherish the beautiful times we had together, even as we navigate the sinister aspects of Cindy's experience - the surveillance, the financial burden, and the risks associated with aligning with this organization. But don't think for a minute that it's all doom and gloom. There are chuckles to be had, particularly when we touch upon the importance of having a will in place, a topic that takes an unexpected, humorous detour.

Finally, we lighten the mood as Cindy brings us into the warmth of her kitchen with her new venture, CiCi's Comfort Cooking. It's a delightful end to a conversation that spans decades, numerous challenges, and the kind of friendship that withstands the test of time and trials. So come, lend me your ears, and together let's explore the complex world of Scientology through Cindy's extraordinary journey.

episodes.title: Scientology Stories #16 w/ Claire Headley - Liz Ferris' Search for Truth and Family
episodes.description:
What happens when a life built within the confines of Scientology comes face to face with the harsh reality of personal loss, family estrangement, and a back-breaking search for truth? Our guest today, Liz Ferris, embarks on a journey to answer these very questions. Walk with us as Liz peels back the layers of her story, recounting her childhood within the organization, the severance of ties with her father, Bob Ferris, her tumultuous coming-out experience, and the uncomfortable truth about Scientology's stance on love and personal relationships.

In a world where you never compare notes about experiences, Liz's narrative is a beacon of hope and strength. Through the ups and downs of her quest for her long-lost father, Liz chronicles everything - from the crushing defeat of leaving the Scientology compound, to the unwavering support she finds in her friend Vanessa and her partner. We traverse through the labyrinth of family issues, restraining orders, and the uncanny similarities to North Korea, all while emphasizing the significance of having a mandatory reporter by your side.

As Liz's search for Bob Ferris continues, she faces an onslaught of challenges - false report numbers, deceptive elder protective services, and the frustration of navigating an untrustworthy system. Yet, hope shines through as we discuss the strides Liz is making to find answers - obtaining police reports and looking into body camera footage. Despite the obstacles, Liz stands tall, drawing strength from her partner and the promise of truth that lies ahead. Buckle up as we explore this rollercoaster journey, a testament to Liz Ferris' resilience and a story you won't want to miss.

episodes.title: Where is Shelly Miscavige? #12 w/ Claire Headley - Shelly's Scientology Upbringing (Part 2)
episodes.description:
What would you do if the world as you knew it was completely governed by a single organization? Can you imagine a childhood devoid of ordinary comforts, where even your education was dictated by a religious organization? This episode tells the chilling tale of one woman, Shelly Miscavige, who lived this life and more, within the formidable walls of the Church of Scientology.

Life wasn't always about billion-year contracts and being a messenger of the church for Shelly. Take a trip with us to her early days in Texas, where her parents' involvement with the Church of Scientology began. We explore how Scientology quickly consumed her family, leading to Shelly's parents leaving her and her siblings while they travelled to England. This departure marked the beginning of the fractures within her family, a significant event that would later shape Shelly's life. We also unearth the disturbing chapters from her childhood, which saw her living in questionable conditions in Mexico, forced to hide at the sight of authorities.

Delving deeper into Shelly's life, we discuss her time as a part of the Commodore's Messenger Organization, Golden Era Productions, and Author Services in Los Angeles. We illuminate the changes that came with David Miscavige taking over the Religious Technology Center, leading to her recall to the headquarters in 1987. Finally, we bring to light her relationship with L Ron Hubbard and the interesting story behind her nickname, 'Miss Panache'. This episode offers a thorough exploration of the life and disappearance of Shelly Miscavige, pulling back the veil on the often-secretive world of Scientology. Tune in as we unravel this mysterious tale.

episodes.title: The Story of Serge Obolensky - An Aftermath Foundation Survivor Story
episodes.description:
The Aftermath Foundation was established to help those who want to leave Scientology and the Sea Organization, but who lack a system of support they can rely on while getting on their feet in the outside world.

This is an Aftermath Foundation Survivor Story: The Story of Serge Obolensky.

Serge was raised in scientology from a very young age and joined the Sea Organization at age 11, committing to a billion years of service to scientology. Serge's parents and his brothers were also part of the Sea Organization. After several years of hard labor, no education, no family support, and a rigorous schedule, Serge's life was in ruins. At age 19, while he was living on L Ron Hubbard Way, Serge had a fireworks accident in which he lost both of his hands and one of his eyes. Thereafter he was promptly cut off from his family and all mental and emotional support, as a result of which Serge was homeless on Hollywood Blvd for 10 years.

The Aftermath Foundation presents The Story of Serge Obolensky.

episodes.title: Scientology Stories #14  w/ Claire Headley - Ex-Sea Org Member - Hana Eltringham Whitfield - Part #1
episodes.description:
This is our next segment of Scientology stories. Join us as we interview Hana Eltringham Whitfield, who appeared in the HBO Documentary Going Clear, Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath, to name two of many documentaries.

Hana was a Scientologist and a member of the Sea Organization for over twenty years. She captained two of Hubbard’s ships, ran his organizations, and was Deputy Commodore under Hubbard in the United States for two years. After Hana left, and as a way of giving back, Hana and her late husband, Jerry Whitfield began helping families retrieve their children and spouses from Scientology and the Sea Org. This is part one of Hana’s story.

episodes.title: Scientology Spy Files #16 - Scientology Catch one of our Spies!
episodes.description:
- Step right into a world of subterfuge and covert operations as we pull back the curtain on Scientology's secret spy network. This episode guarantees to leave you awestruck and bemused by the lengths to which Scientology went in order to divulge the identity of our spy. We'll be discussing everything from the purchasing of phone records to the rummaging of garbage, and the activation of Scientologist spies and private investigators. Get ready for a captivating tale about our contact who bravely risked it all to provide us with crucial materials and an escape route from the Cine Castle.

Stay tuned as we unravel the intricate web of Scientology's hunt for the intriguing spy code-named 'BFG'. It's a journey that involves Chuck Beatty, an ex-Sea Org member, and the far-reaching influence of Tom Cruise's lawyer, Burt Fields. We'll also delve into the peculiar last years of L. Ron Hubbard, and his curious choice to pen science fiction books, leaving Scientology with a questionable succession plan. And as a cherry on top, we'll have a sneak peek into a real-life spy-studded birthday party. So, buckle up for an episode brimming with suspense, intrigue, and unexpected twists. It's a ride you won't want to miss!

Join us for another episode of the Scientology Spy Files. In this episode we cover two different OSA Internal (Scientology Spy Wing) documents from May 2006.

episodes.description:
BFG Store now Live!

In this series we will explore the life and experiences of Shelly Miscavige, leading up to Shelly's current status as one of many missing executives in Scientology. Shelly was the second in command to David Miscavige for many years, not to mention she is his wife. Now she hasn't been seen or heard from in many years. How can someone outright disappear in today's world? How does Scientology get away with this? How can Scientology's programming run so deep that people in Scientology accept this as normal? Our first guest is Marc Headley, who we interview to get Marc's perspective and experience having known and worked with Shelly Miscavige for 15 years at the 500 acre compound located in Gilman Hot Springs, CA.

Today, Jefferson works as a graphic designer in Portland, Oregon. He continues to assist individuals and families who have been victims of Scientology abuse.

Jeff has written three books since leaving Scientology.
